]]>Deepa Suryanarayanhttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/singer-actor-emcee-monica-dogra-on-a-himalayan-holiday-5237.html<![CDATA[Mango magic ]]>2016-05-12 16:13:50Deepa Suryanarayanhttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/food/5-easytoprepare-recipes-with-delicious-mangoes-5236.html

Summer's here. This means it's mango season. We give you five awesome delicious recipes that will leave you asking for more

Continue reading ...

]]>

 

Summer's here. This means it's mango season. We give you five awesome delicious recipes that will leave you asking for more.

 

Aamras
Ingredients
400 g mangoes
½ tsp cardamom powder
A pinch of saffron
sugar
¼ tsp dry ginger powder
Water or milk as required

Procedure
Choose ripe Alphonso mangoes, peel and chop them. Put them in a blender and blend.
Add cardamom powder and crushed saffron strands.
Stir well. Add water/milk to change consistency of the aamras.
Garnish with dry fruits (optional).
Serve chilled, with puris.

__PAGEBREAK__

 

 

Khao Niaow Ma Mung
Ingredients
200 g Thai sweet rice
¼ tsp salt
200 ml coconut milk
5 tbsp brown sugar
2 ripe mangoes, peeled and cubed

Procedure
Soak the rice in 1 cup
water for about  20 to 30 minutes. Do not drain out the rice. Add ¾ cup water, ¼ cup coconut milk, ¼ tsp salt, and 1 tbsp brown sugar to the rice. Bring to a gentle boil. Then, partially cover the pot with a lid and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the coconut milk has been absorbed into the rice.
Turn off the heat, but leave the pot on the burner with the lid on for 5 to 10 minutes.
To make the sauce, warm (do not boil) the remaining coconut milk over medium-low heat, for about
five minutes. Add the remaining sugar, stirring to dissolve. Check the sweetness, adding more sugar, if desired.
To  assemble, place a few mounds of sticky rice in each serving bowl. Top with mango slices.
Pour the sauce over it. It should look like an English pudding with custard sauce, with the mounds of rice floating in sauce.

__PAGEBREAK__

 

 

DUO OF MANGO SALAD
Ingredients
1 medium sized raw mango
1 medium sized fresh Alphonso mango
100 g tomatoes
20 g rocket leaves
5 g paprika
Seasoning (as required)
5 ml orange juice reduction
3 ml vinegar

Procedure
Slice the raw mango with the help of a mandolin slicer and then cut into juliennes. If you don’t have a mandolin, use a knife.
Dice the alphonso mange.
Rinse and clean the rocket leaves.
Blanch the tomato, then remove the skin & seeds and cut it into dices.
Make a vinaigrette dressing with the orange juice reduction, vinegar and olive oil.
Whisk paprika and vinaigrette to finish off the salad dressing.
To make the salad, mix alphonso mango, tomato & rocket leaves, pour the dressing and mix it well.
To serve, arrange the salad on a plate and finally top it with julienne of raw mangoes.
(Recipe courtesy: Fable)

__PAGEBREAK__

 

Alphonso Mango Sushi
Ingredients
Filling
2 Sliced Alphonso mangoes
For sushi rice:
1.5 cups uncooked Japanese rice
1.5 cups water
¼ cup coconut milk
1 tsp sugar
1 Lime juice

Garnish
Nori sheet
Procedure
For Rice:-
Wash and dry the rice in a colander for an hour, before cooking it.
Now in a small bowl, whisk together lime juice & sugar and set aside.
In a large non-stick sauce pan, add water, rice and coconut milk and stir till the rice is tender
Now remove from the heat, keep it covered and let it stand for 5 minutes.
Stir in the sugar and lime juice.
To make sushi
Cut some of the ripe mangoes into small cubes and thin slices.
Take a small amount of rice in your hand, place some mango on the top and press down slightly.
Cover with another mound of rice and firmly shape it into a triangular shape. Take care to fully cover the filling on all sides with rice.
Garnish it with a nori sheet.
Serve with wasabi, Japanese soya sauce, pickled ginger & pickled vegetables.
(Recipe courtesy: Executive Chef Ashvini Kumar of Four Points by Sheraton Navi Mumbai, Vashi)

__PAGEBREAK__

 

Siam surprise
Ingredients
2 kaffir lime leaves, plus 2 for garnish
½ Thai mango, cubed
4-5 ice cubes
30 ml mango juice
60 ml gin
20 ml lime juice
20 ml sugar syrup
1 Thai mango wedge, for garnish

Procedure
Bruise kaffir lime leaves. Add half a mango and muddle. Add ice and all
the ingredients.
Shake well and double strain in a Collins glass. Garnish with half a mango wedge and kaffir lime leaves.

 

]]>Deepa Suryanarayanhttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/food/5-easytoprepare-recipes-with-delicious-mangoes-5236.html<![CDATA[Throwback to Anushka Sharma in Femina! ]]>2016-05-11 17:46:04Arushi Dutthttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/celeb-buzz/a-look-at-anushka-sharma-gracing-the-covers-of-femina-over-the-years-5229.html

Celebrating Anushka Sharma in Femina over the years!

Continue reading ...

]]>

From her first film Rab Ne Bana Di Jodi, starring Shah Rukh Khan, this gal has definitely come a long way. Anushka Sharma continues to make a mark in the industry dabbling in films and with her very recent venture into production. And now, with her upcoming release, Sultan, starring Salman Khan, Anushka appears once again in a different avatar. We await patiently for what more she has in store for us! Until then, we celebrate Anushka's success with a throwback to her Femina covers over the years:

Our first cover with Anushka in 2010 showed her in a bold, dark and edgy avatar.

__PAGEBREAK__

In our first out of three 2013 covers with Anushka, she revealed more to her personality than just looks:

When asked about beauty:
"I feel beautiful on days I know I have done good work, or have been able to stand up for myself. Women who don't follow a certain pattern or are not stereotyped are beautiful. Recently, I met Mamata Banerjee, and was awed by her simplicity. I thought she was beautiful."

When asked about being a damsel in distress:
"I could never be that. My father is an army man. He is the one who influenced me to have opinions and principles and follow them. I'm just like my dad. I'm quite a loner and I like my space."

When asked about her future plans:
"If you ask me what I want to do after five years, I'll be very scared. But I know what I'm doing right now."

__PAGEBREAK__

In our 2nd 2013 cover with Anushka, we discovered that there was more to this "nice girl" as many put it. We spoke to a few people closely associated with her, and here's what they had to say:

When asked about stardom, director Shoojit Sircar said:
"I don't think I've ever seen attitude from her. She's quick to laugh at herself, and at the same time has her head in the game."

When asked on her style evolution, stylist Allia Al Rufai said:
"Anushka's style has a certain edge to it now, while earlier it was safer. It's a very modern, sexy look. Her makeup choices used to be subtle and barely there, but now she's using edgy, bolder lip colours like pink and red to up the oomph."

 

__PAGEBREAK__

In our final 2013 cover, this Bollywood 'outsider-turned-insider' as we put it gave us a few more pointers on life as a producer, and her venture with NH10:

When asked about working as a producer:
"This is the most exciting time of my life. I'm learning more about film-making every day and that is exactly what I wanted. I'm involved in all aspects from scripting to casting from finances to marketing."

When asked her opinion on relationships:
"When you get older, you realise it's more than just going out on dates, talking on the phone for hours and taking holidays together. It has taken me a year to understand that. If you had asked me this question last year, I'd have said no. Today, I think I'm open to being in a relationship."

When asked about what makes her the happiest:
"My work life makes me the happiest. I'm doing movies and also venturing into film production."

__PAGEBREAK__

Speaking to Anushka right after the shoot of her new film Ae Dil Hain Mushkil, in our latest cover of the 2015 anniversary issue, we got to learn more about this super bold and talented actor. Here are some excerpts:

When asked about support from family:
"My parents and I talked about it at home. They are very rational people and understand the society we live in. They just told me: imagine what girls and women living in smaller towns and villages are dealing with every day."

When asked about balancing film with production:
"I have started to learn to prioritise. Today, I understand and see my work and commitment in a different light. I've always been the kind of person who is looking to do extra. I have been multi-tasking all my life."

When asked about success:
"To me, success is the ability to do the things I want to do. I come from a non-filmi background so one of my achievements is my solid conviction; I don't get swayed by past successes and failures."

When asked about Virat Kohli:
"We are like-minded individuals from middle class families and whatever we have achieved today is because of our hard work. Our values are very similar and we are grateful for what we have today. Having shared our life's experiences has made us stronger.

When asked about being unfairly blamed for India's performance at the World Cup:
Initially I thought it was started by a bunch of uneducated people. But when I visited their profiles on Twitter I came away even more surprised. They were marketing executives and engineers. it made me realise so many things. Our society is still so misogynistic; I was being aware of my sex and the perception that I was only good at being a distraction. I also saw a complete lack of compassion for our fellow beings. it was very annoying.

We wish this multitasker all the success ahead, and hope to keep seeing her on the big screen in a diverse set of memorable characters.

]]>Arushi Dutthttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/celeb-buzz/a-look-at-anushka-sharma-gracing-the-covers-of-femina-over-the-years-5229.html<![CDATA[Say cheese! ]]>2016-05-10 16:32:56feminahttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/getting-cheesy-5219.html

Classic, cheese-filled European dishes for that 'yummy-in-my-tummy' feel.

Continue reading ...

]]>

It's hard not to smile when someone mentions the word 'cheese', isn't it? Now imagine sitting down after a hard day's work and spooning a mouthful of delicious, cheese-filled tart, risotto or panna cotta—did we hear you go 'oo la la?'

Mascarpone Cheese:

Requires:

2 packets rasberries

1 tbsp unflavoured powdered gelatin

2 cups heavy cream

1 cup whole milk

6 tbsp sugar

75 g mascarpone cheese

Process:

1) Puree rasberries in a food processor. Strain and discard seeds. Pour 1 cup puree into a saucepan. Keep the rest aside.

2) Sprinkle gelatin over the puree and set aside for five minutes. Heat the mixture, stirring gently, until the gelatin dissolves. Whisk in cream, milk, sugar and mascarpone cheese.

3) Strain the mixture and pour it into disposable cups. Refrigerate for at least four hours.

4) Once set, turn each cup upside down and place them on serving plates. Give the cup a gentle squeeze to unmold. Serve immediately with the remaining puree.

__PAGEBREAK__

Parmesan Cheese Red Wine Risotto:

Requires:

2 1/2 cups pumpkin peeled and cubed

3 tbsp olive oil

Salt and Pepper

1/3 cup shallots, finely chopped

1 packet baby mushrooms

2 garlic cloves minced

1 1/2 cups brown Arborio rice

1/2 cup red wine

4 cups vegetale broth

1/4 cup grated parmesan

2 tbsp basil chopped

1 tbsp oregano chopped

Process:

1) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Brush pumpkin cubes with 1 tbsp oil and season with salt and pepper. Salute over medium heat for about 12 to 15 minutes. Transfer to a baking sheet and roast for four to five minutes. Set aside.

2) Saute shallots in a pan. Add mushrooms and garlic and cook for three minutes.

3) Add rice and cook for a minute. Pour red wine and cook until the wine is absorbed. Gradually add vegetable broth to the rice mixture, stirring constantly and allowing the broth to be absorbed.

4) After all the broth has been added, mash 1/2 the pumpkin cubes and stir them into the rice. Add the remaining pumpkin cubes, cheese, basil, and oregano. Serve hot.

__PAGEBREAK__

Parmigiano-Reggiano Cheese Ratatouille Tart:

Requires:

1 packet pie dough

2 tbsp Parmigiano-Reggiano grated

1 packet soft cheese crumbled

1/2 cup heavy cream

2 tsp thyme leaves, chopped

3 eggs

2 zucchinis, sliced

2 summer squashes, sliced

1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved

Salt and Pepper to taste

3 tbsp extra virgin olive oil

Instructions:

1) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Roll the dough out to fit the tart pan. Place the dough inside the pan. Press to fit along the sides. Cut off excess dough. Place in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes.

2) Prick the dough all over with a fork. Place parchment paper on top of it. Fill with raw baking beans. Place in the oven to blind bake for 10 minutes. Remove the beans and parchment. Sprinkle about 2 tbsp of freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano on top of the crust. Bake for another 5 minutes.

3) Whisk cheese, heavy cream, thyme leaves and eggs in a food processor until the mixture becomes smooth. Season with salt and pper.

4) Pour the cheese mixture into the baked crust. Place the zucchini and squash on top of it and press down a little. Place the tomatoes, flat-side-up on top of this. Brush the vegetables with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake for another 15-20 minutes. Serve hot.

 

]]>feminahttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/getting-cheesy-5219.html<![CDATA[Out on vacation! ]]>2016-05-10 15:03:12feminahttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/the-three-best-celeb-instagram-accounts-to-inspire-your-summer-holiday-5218.html

]]>feminahttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/the-three-best-celeb-instagram-accounts-to-inspire-your-summer-holiday-5218.html<![CDATA[Dil Chahta Hai Holiday! ]]>2016-05-09 16:28:11Anindita Ghoshhttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/picture-perfect-locations-for-bollywood-movies-5214.html

Five movie locations to scout for a summer getaway!

Continue reading ...

]]>

Yash Chopra, the late Bollywood film-maker, in whose romantic movies Switzerland became a recurring leitmotif, was honoured with a bronze statue in the heart of Interlaken in Switzerland, by Swiss officials. Films have always scouted for picture postcard locations and tourists have followed suit. If you haven’t had a holiday this summer, here are five movie locations that can make great summer getaways.

Name of the film: Spectre
Location: Austria
If snow-covered mountains are what your heart yearns for this summer, head to Austria, Sölden to be specific, where one of the main action sequences in Spectre was shot in the Austrian Alps. A popular ski area and a centre for winter sports, this is where you saw Daniel Craig as James Bond running across the snow and firing at the bad guys. 
__PAGEBREAK__

Name of the film: 3 Idiots
Location: Ladakh, Pangong Lake
The Pangong Lake in Ladakh, also known as the Hallow Lake, runs across the  India-China border. And if that wasn’t exciting enough, the cast of the movie, 3 Idiots came together at the lake for the emotionally charged climax. The serene location can make for a great holiday. The best time to visit--from May to September, when the passes open, letting in vehicles into the otherwise inaccessible terrain.

__PAGEBREAK__

Name of the film: 3G
Location: Island of Fiji.
Fiji is a holiday destination with about 300 tropical islands that make it a perfect getaway. But the golden sands and the cerulean blue seas of Fiji were the location for a chilling horror movie starring Neil Nitin Mukesh and Sonal Chauhan. But one look at pictures of this palm-fringed tropical island, is enough to convince us that its the perfect place for a tranquil getaway.

__PAGEBREAK____

Name of the film: Dilwale
Location: Iceland
Iceland, of the famous Northern Lights fame, became the location for the romantic song Gerua from Dilwale, starring Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol. We'll let the spectacular shots of the Jokulsarlon glacier lagoon, the gushing Skogafoss waterfall and dramatic Reynisfjara Beach (Black beach), in the film do the convincing. Iceland, in the summer, is still cool and chilly for someone used to tropical summers.

__PAGEBREAK__

Name of the film:  Akira
Location: Norway
Akira became the first film from Sandalwood to be shot in Norway. The just-released film offers sweeping landscapes of the fabled sceneries in Norway, including the majestic mountains, cavernous valleys and clear blue water bodies. Averaging around 13 degrees C in summer, it’s as close to paradise as you can get on earth.

 

]]>Anindita Ghoshhttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/picture-perfect-locations-for-bollywood-movies-5214.html<![CDATA[Travel like a pro with these celeb hacks ]]>2016-05-09 13:06:51Anindita Ghoshhttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/travel-like-a-pro-with-these-celeb-hacks-5212.html

Celebrities are pros at frequent travel. Learn how to be as savvy as them with these star-inspired travel-smart solutions.

Continue reading ...

]]>

 

Keep yourself hydrated
If Priyanka Chopra has a travel tip to share then we suggest you listen to her. After all, our most successful celeb export till date is used to 20-hour flights as she zips between north America and India a number of times each month to keep her many commitments. Peecee manages to keep herself dewy fresh and bushy-tailed by tanking up on plenty of water on long-haul flights and slathering on tons of moisturiser on her face, body and hands to avoid dryness. She has also been quoted as saying that she applies a face mask around 20 minutes before the plane lands to keep her face peachy soft. The air inside an aeroplane cabin is very dry because the humidity levels in there are only about 10-20 per cent compared to a comfortable indoor humidity level of 30-35 percent. So, keeping yourself hydrated in such an environment is very important.

 

__PAGEBREAK__

Boots and sneakers over strappy heels
If you ever spot airport regulars like Anushka Sharma and Deepika Padukone, scan their footwear. Chances are that these divas are wearing sturdy boots or sneakers on their flights. Not strappy heels. While there’s nothing quite as comfy as a pair of comfy sneakers or well-worn boots on a journey, flying guidelines also advocate sensible footwear on flight so that you are perfectly equipped for an emergency landing that requires you to exit the plane and run away from it as fast as possible—something your high heels are unlikely to allow you to do! Slips-ons are great for times when you have to take off your footwear for security. And wearing heavy boots makes makes more sense than stuffing them in your suitcase and paying for excess baggage!

 

__PAGEBREAK__

Carry a jacket
Have you noticed how our uber stylish stars like Kangana Ranaut always seem to be wearing or carrying a jacket when they are travelling regardless of the outdoor temperature? Well, that’s because temperatures inside the aircraft and at waiting lounges can get really low and uncomfortable. So why shiver away in your thin sleeveless shirt and risk catching a horrible cold when you can be snug and cosy inside a jacket or shrug when it gets a tad too cold for you.

 

__PAGEBREAK__

Watch what you eat and drink on a flight
Bloating is a very common problem faced by fliers everywhere. Besides being embarrassing, it can be very uncomfortable and harmful to your health as well. The science says that when a plane climbs to 30,000 feet, the air pressure drops and cause the gases inside your intestine to expand, much like what happens to a can of cola! So stuffing yourself with greasy, gassy food will only make your trip extremely uncomfortable. Among the things that you should avoid are carbonated beverages; alcohol, as it dehydrates you further, sugary edibles and sugar-free snacks as they contain flatulence causing chemicals, greasy and over salty foods. While musician Karsh Kale prefers to eat before a flight and not on it, singer Monica Dogra shuns in-flight alcohol preferring to sip some wine after reaching her destination to beat the jet lag.

 


__PAGEBREAK__

Never let work interfere with fun
And finally, the most sage advice of all from sexy Sunny Leone who advised Priyanka Chopra to take time off from her hectic schedule shooting for Quantico and see the sights in LA. When Pee Cee posted a pic of lowers on Twitter, Sunny tweeted back with “@priyankachopra you should take a trip down to the flower district down town LA. You will fall in love!”

 

So the next time you are on a work trip, make sure that you allow yourself enough time to enjoy the sights and sounds of the place you are in.

PHOTOGRAPHS: YOGEN SHAH

]]>Anindita Ghoshhttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/travel-like-a-pro-with-these-celeb-hacks-5212.html<![CDATA[Radhika Apte, Unplugged ]]>2016-05-09 12:32:34Arushi Dutthttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/celeb-buzz/radhika-apte-speaks-to-femina-behind-the-scenes-of-the-cover-shoot-5210.html

]]>Arushi Dutthttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/celeb-buzz/radhika-apte-speaks-to-femina-behind-the-scenes-of-the-cover-shoot-5210.html<![CDATA[Whip up a Sunday brunch ]]>2016-05-07 07:06:21feminahttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/food/whip-up-a-sunday-brunch-5196.html

Chef Dipak Adhikary of Mumbai gastropub The Good Wife whips up delicious, no-cook meals that are perfect for lazy brunches at home.

Continue reading ...

]]>

Chef Dipak Adhikary of Mumbai gastropub The Good Wife whips up delicious, no-cook meals that are perfect for lazy brunches at home.

Moroccan couscous 
10 g asparagus
10 g broccoli
5 ml extra virgin olive oil
1 tsp lemon juice
100 g couscous, steamed
50 g pomegranate mixed lettuce
25 g red bell peppers
25 g yellow bell peppers
5 g fresh mint leaves
25 g zucchini
salt and pepper,to taste

SERVES: 1 > PREP TIME: 15 minutes
1. Blanch the asparagus and broccoli in hot water till they soften a bit. Plunge into cold water immediately.
2. Chop the red and yellow bell peppers, zucchini, asparagus, broccoli and mint leaves.
3. To make the dressing, mix olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper together. Toss the chopped vegetables with the couscous, pomegranate and dressing. Serve on mixed lettuce leaves.

Tip: For fluffier, tastier steamed couscous, pour boiling water over it in a flat casserole.

__PAGEBREAK__


Panzanella sALAD
250 g red tomatoes, diced into large pieces
100 g cherry mozzarella
10 g black olives
5 g fresh basil leaves
100 g arugula leaves
3 g garlic flakes
50 g bread croutons

For the dressing
15 ml extra virgin olive oil
5 ml balsamic vinegar
3 g parsley, chopped
salt and pepper, to taste

SERVES: 1 > PREP TIME: 10 minutes
1. Mix the tomatoes, mozzarella, olives, basil, arugula and garlic flakes together.
2. Mix all the dressing ingredients.
3. Toss the salad with the dressing just before serving.
4. Garnish with croutons.

Tip:Let the salad stand for 15 minutes before serving it to allow the flavours to mingle.

__PAGEBREAK__

 

 

Dark and white chocolate terrine with fruit salsa

2 egg yolks
10 g castor sugar
100 g white
chocolate, melted
100 g dark chocolate, melted
200 g chocolate sponge cake

For the fruit salsa
10 g strawberries
5 g kiwis
5 g red apples
5 g pomegranates
1 Thai chilli, finely chopped
1 g mint, chopped
1 tsp lemon juice

SERVES: 1 > PREP TIME: 9 hours
1. Mix one egg yolk and half the castor sugar with the white chocolate. Mix the remaining egg yolk
and castor sugar with the dark chocolate.
2. Place the sponge cake in a deep dish. Pour the white chocolate mixture over it. Chill in the fridge to set.
3. After two to three hours, take it out and pour the dark chocolate mixture over it.
Set overnight or for at least six hours.
4. To make the fruit salsa, dice all the fruits and mix with the other ingredients.
5. To serve, cut the terrine into portions and garnish with the fruit salsa.

Tip:line the cake dish with parchment so that it is easy to remove the terrine when serving.

Photographs: The Good Wife, Mumbai

 

]]>feminahttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/food/whip-up-a-sunday-brunch-5196.html<![CDATA[Summer cocktail party! ]]>2016-05-06 17:19:21Namrata D'souzahttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/peppy-summer-cocktails-5206.html

Three slurp-worthy cocktails to whip up this season

Continue reading ...

]]>

What's the best part about summer, you ask? The fact that you can sip your way through yummy, delicious drinks all day long! Here are three cocktails that you can whip up in a jiffy and that will make your summer weekends more pleasurable.

HONEY GINGER
Ingredients
68 ml bourbon whiskey
ginger ale as required
dash of bitters (any bitter syrup, for example, lemon)
a lemon wedge for garnish
Preparation
Fill a highball glass with ice and pour all the ingredients over it. Garnish with a lemon wedge.

__PAGEBREAK__

KENTUCKY SPLASH
Ingredients
45 ml bourbon whiskey
45 ml sweetened lime juice
270 ml lemonade
Preparation
Pour all the ingredients in a one litre pitcher and enjoy!
PS: For more fun, call a few friends over and keep the extra glasses ready!

__PAGEBREAK__

JIMMY’S CHOCOLATE
Ingredients
112.5 ml bourbon whiskey
45 ml fresh lemon juice
45 ml dark chocolate syrup
22.5 ml fresh egg white
Praline or orange for garnish
Preparation
Pour the bourbon whiskey over ice. Add the lemon juice, chocolate syrup and egg white to this. Shake well.
Use a sieve and pour the liquid into a chilled glass. Garnish with praline and orange.

All recipes and images courtesy: Jim Beam

 

]]>Namrata D'souzahttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/peppy-summer-cocktails-5206.html<![CDATA[7 Sitcoms that made us LOL! ]]>2016-05-06 16:48:53Arushi Dutthttp://www.femina.in/lifestyle/7-sitcoms-that-made-us-lol-on-world-laughter-day-5203.html

Re-visit 7 sitcoms that make us LOL on World Laughter Day!

Continue reading ...

]]>

Re-visit 7 sitcoms that made us LOL on World Laughter Day!

It’s World Laughter Day! Believe it or not, May 7 is a whole day dedicated to jokes and positive vibes. Isn’t that something we could all use in our lives? Did you know that World Laughter Day was initiated in Mumbai back in 1998? Now it’s celebrated worldwide to raise awareness on the health benefits from laughing. We thought we’d have our own celebration by paying a tribute to seven of the most hilarious sitcoms that have made us LOL. Have a look:   

1) F.R.I.E.N.D.S

via GIPHY

You all knew this was going to be at the top of the list. Whether it’s the adorable chemistry between all the characters, the witty one-liners, the hilarious punches, and all the relatable situations, FRIENDS is a TV show that is timeless. What has been your favourite episode of all time?

__PAGEBREAK__

2) The Big Bang Theory

via GIPHY

Socially awkward physicists who discuss science, video games, and all things geeky, is what pretty much sums up The Big Bang Theory. But aside from the obvious, this show has managed to top charts worldwide because of its humour and wit. Sheldon’s quirkiness along with the adorable chemistry between all friends brings out the best in ‘BBT.’ It’s one of the few shows (and one of my personal favourites) that has managed to bring nerds into the limelight of entertainment.

__PAGEBREAK__

3) Modern Family

via GIPHY

Family sitcoms have to only appeal to families…uh not true! Modern Family is one of those family sitcoms that continues to be a crowd favourite across ages! There’s so much that can be bland about following a family’s life, but this sitcom scores high, with its sharp writing and interesting characters. Not to mention Gloria’s over-the-top accent that has us LOL’ing every time!

__PAGEBREAK__

4) New Girl

via GIPHY

Whether it’s Jess’s socially awkward traits or the hilarious exchanges she’ll have with the rest of the characters, New Girl just makes us happy. The fact that Jess’s character is so relatable definitely helps! She goofs up, gets a little lost in life, love, and then gets back up again. Though the writers have played around with some elements a bit, the show is now back to its basics structure, and that’s what makes it so great.

__PAGEBREAK__

5) How I Met Your Mother

via GIPHY

With clever one-liners, eye-rolling puns, and wacky character relationships, this show never gets old. The best part of ‘HIMYM’ is that it manages to not only tickle the funny bones, but also gets you a little choked up, giving the perfect combination of drama and comedy. Along with the jokes, the ultimate mystery leading up to the reveal of the ‘mother’ makes it an even better treat to watch.

__PAGEBREAK__

6) Everybody Loves Raymond

via GIPHY

Let’s go back in time just a little, with yet another family sitcom that was a hit back in the 90s! Taking simple middle-class family situations, from in-law troubles to some healthy rivalry between brothers, this entertaining bunch kept us laughing throughout. And who can forget five-time Emmy Award winner, the late Doris Roberts, who played the part of the well-meaning yet annoying mom to Raymond to perfection?

__PAGEBREAK__

7) Fresh Prince of Bel Air

via GIPHY

The early days of Will Smith…need we say more? A whole lot of animated jokes, Carlton’s spontaneous dancing, and Hillary’s ‘Valley Girl’ accent is what made this show from 90s one of THE funniest sitcoms on the planet. But the best part is that underneath all the gags, Will’s great acting struck great emotional chords with us all. Never to be forgotten!

And there you have it! Tweet at us @FeminaIndia to tell us which funny sitcom tops your list on #WorldLaughterDay. Keep laughing!
